channel.title: Change what you start with
channel.description: How can you change what you start with and how to change the items given by ::starter?

item.title: Change what you start with
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

newb pk3r, pk dem newbs…
Why can’t people listen to a post before flaming?

Read full topic

item.title: Change what you start with
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“andrew1234321, post:2, topic:86347”]go to client.java, search for “starter” or w/e the command is for starter (type starter if the command is ::starter)

Change the things below to what item it gives you.

To change how a player looks like when they first log in go to player.java and search

		//Giving the player an unique look

change whats under it, should look something like this

//Giving the player an unique look playerEquipment[playerHat]=6109; playerEquipment[playerCape]=6111; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585; playerEquipment[playerChest]=6107; playerEquipment[playerShield]=3842; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6108; playerEquipment[playerHands]=6110; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=2579; playerEquipment[playerRing]=6735; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=4587;[/quote]
That’s what the player is wearing when he/she logs in.
Not the command ::starter

Read full topic

item.title: Change what you start with
item.dc:creator: @billycu billycu
item.description:
@billycu wrote:

thank you so much for helping me lol

Read full topic

item.title: Change what you start with
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

To change what ::starter gives you, just search

"starter"

In client.java and change the part that says

addItem (995, 100000);

Or whatever it actually says.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pking_Dragon wrote:

What Andrew said pretty much covers it. No need for more explanation

item.title: Change what you start with

item.description:
@andrew1234321 wrote:

go to client.java, search for “starter” or w/e the command is for starter (type starter if the command is ::starter)

Change the things below to what item it gives you.

To change how a player looks like when they first log in go to player.java and search

		//Giving the player an unique look

change whats under it, should look something like this

//Giving the player an unique look playerEquipment[playerHat]=6109; playerEquipment[playerCape]=6111; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=6585; playerEquipment[playerChest]=6107; playerEquipment[playerShield]=3842; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6108; playerEquipment[playerHands]=6110; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=2579; playerEquipment[playerRing]=6735; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=-1; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=4587;
